tweets.text: Today is #NationalGunViolenceAwareness Day. As a former prosecutor, I've seen 1st-hand the kind of damage guns can cause to communities and families. 58% of American adults say they or someone they care for has experienced gun violence. It is time to put an end to this bloodshed.

Last week, it was Virginia Beach. But day after day and year after year, too many families and communities are shattered by senseless gun violence. We can't get numb to this. On National Gun Violence Awareness Day, pledge to speak out, #WearOrange — and vote — to protect lives.

DELETED SCENE: 

Gloria Mott attempts to shoot Regina with a gun #AHSFreakShow https://t.co/U1Xd0dOSKY

Today, I #WearOrange for my son, Jordan Davis.

I #WearOrange for the nearly 100 Americans who die each & every day as a result of gun violence.

I #WearOrange because #EnoughIsEnough — I pray that my colleagues will join me in taking action to #EndGunViolence. https://t.co/B5GZ6yjRIi

The tens of thousands of Americans who die each year from gun violence deserve better than "thoughts and prayers." Shame on any member of Congress who refuses to take action to end gun violence. Today & every day we must demand better. #WearOrange #NationalGunViolenceAwarenessDay

"I think being an American and exercising our rights far outweighs my personal achievements and career goals." Actor Cole Hauser says he isn't worried if his support for the 2nd Amendment costs him in Hollywood. https://t.co/bJ9c2BkUmy

We #WearOrange on National #GunViolenceAwarenessDay to send a clear message: gun violence has no place in our communities. 

We need to speak up. Together, we can be #LouderThanGuns.

Join us and act now → https://t.co/V55ziARs3z https://t.co/peNmEZenyZ

Last week, it was Virginia Beach. But day after day and year after year, too many families and communities are shattered by senseless gun violence. We can't get numb to this. On National Gun Violence Awareness Day, pledge to speak out, #WearOrange — and vote — to protect lives.
